Title.evidence: The study was randomized, double blind, and sham controlled.

Trial_Design.evidence: The study was randomized, double blind, and sham controlled.

Participants.evidence: 87 patients with chronic knee osteoarthritis were randomized

Intervention.evidence: randomized to either cryoneurolysis or a sham procedure

Objective.evidence: The objective was to investigate whether cryoneurolysis was superior to sham in reducing pain intensity in patients with chronic knee osteoarthritis.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the difference in average pain at 14 days after intervention

Blinding.evidence: The study was randomized, double blind, and sham controlled.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 87 patients with chronic knee osteoarthritis were randomized

Number_Analysed.evidence: For the intention-to-treat analysis, no difference was observed

Result_Outcome.evidence: no difference was observed for the primary outcome (0.49; 95% CI, –0.3 to 1.2; P = 0.198)

Harms.evidence: Cryoneurolysis was well tolerated, with minor, transient adverse effects.
